situation: After the school's fire alarm went off unexpectedly, L started rocking back and forth, appearing disoriented and frightened due to the sudden noise.
action: The teacher aide guided L to a quieter part of the school and offered a weighted blanket to help her feel grounded. Soft music through her headphones was also provided.
effect: L gradually calmed down with the sensory inputs, and after a short time, was able to return to her classroom with a greater sense of stability. The thoughtful combination of strategies helped mitigate the immediate impact of the external stimulus.
